page.title: 09HOLLINGBOURNE C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: Hollingbourne County Primary School is a small village school and is the only one serving the D-block. It has approximately 75 children on roll in three classes, one infant and two junior. There three full-time teachers and one part-time teacher and the school is housed in a pleasant Victorian building, erected in 1877 with a modern extension which serves as the infant classroom. It has a lovely setting at the foot of the Downs and is connected to the parish church by a footpath which runs through farmland. The school prides itself on its family atmosphere and individual teaching programmes. There are many clubs and after school activities and the school has a large and beautiful tree lined playing field.
